movie_dex.Title: Midsommar
movie_dex.Plot: A couple travels to Scandinavia to visit a rural hometown's fabled Swedish mid-summer festival. What begins as an idyllic retreat quickly devolves into an increasingly violent and bizarre competition at the hands of a pagan cult.

April 6th, 1917. As a regiment assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

movie_dex.Title: Knives Out
movie_dex.Plot: A detective investigates the death of a patriarch of an eccentric, combative family.

movie_dex.Title: Catch Me If You Can
movie_dex.Writer: Jeff Nathanson (screenplay), Frank Abagnale Jr. (book), Stan Redding (book)
movie_dex.Plot: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

movie_dex.Title: Dallas Buyers Club
movie_dex.Plot: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

movie_dex.Title: The Lobster
movie_dex.Plot: In a dystopian near future, single people, according to the laws of The City, are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in forty-five days or are transformed into beasts and sent off into The Woods.

movie_dex.Title: My Own Private Idaho
movie_dex.Plot: Two best friends living on the streets of Portland as hustlers embark on a journey of self discovery and find their relationship stumbling along the way.

movie_dex.Title: Mad Max: Fury Road
movie_dex.Writer: George Miller, Brendan McCarthy, Nick Lathouris
movie_dex.Plot: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.

movie_dex.Title: Why Women Kill
movie_dex.Plot: An anthology series that follows three women in different decades all living in the same house, as they deal with infidelity and betrayals in their marriages.

movie_dex.Title: Greta
movie_dex.Writer: Ray Wright (story by), Ray Wright (screenplay by), Neil Jordan (screenplay by)
movie_dex.Plot: A young woman befriends a lonely widow who's harboring a dark and deadly agenda toward her.

movie_dex.Title: Predestination
movie_dex.Writer: Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig, Robert A. Heinlein (based on the short story "All You Zombies" by)
movie_dex.Plot: For his final assignment, a top temporal agent must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time. The chase turns into a unique, surprising and mind-bending exploration of love, fate, identity and time travel taboos.

movie_dex.Title: Parasite
movie_dex.Writer: Bong Joon Ho (story by), Bong Joon Ho (screenplay by), Jin-won Han (screenplay by)
movie_dex.Plot: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

movie_dex.Title: Inception
movie_dex.Plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.

movie_dex.Title: Kill Your Darling
movie_dex.Plot: N/A

movie_dex.Title: The Darjeeling Limited
movie_dex.Writer: Wes Anderson, Roman Coppola, Jason Schwartzman
movie_dex.Plot: A year after their father's funeral, three brothers travel across India by train in an attempt to bond with each other.

movie_dex.Title: The Reader
movie_dex.Plot: Post-WWII Germany: Nearly a decade after his affair with an older woman came to a mysterious end, law student Michael Berg re-encounters his former lover as she defends herself in a war-crime trial.

movie_dex.Title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
movie_dex.Writer: Jane Goldman (screenplay by), Matthew Vaughn (screenplay by), Mark Millar (based on the comic book "The Secret Service" by), Dave Gibbons (based on the comic book "The Secret Service" by)
movie_dex.Plot: A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.

movie_dex.Title: The Heat
movie_dex.Plot: An uptight FBI Special Agent is paired with a foul-mouthed Boston cop to take down a ruthless drug lord.

movie_dex.Title: I Love You Phillip Morris
movie_dex.Writer: John Requa, Glenn Ficarra, Steve McVicker (book)
movie_dex.Plot: A cop turns con man once he comes out of the closet. Once imprisoned, he meets the second love of his life, whom he'll stop at nothing to be with.

movie_dex.Title: On Chesil Beach
movie_dex.Plot: Based on Ian McEwan's novel. In 1962 England, a young couple find their idyllic romance colliding with issues of sexual freedom and societal pressure, leading to an awkward and fateful wedding night.

movie_dex.Title: I, Robot
movie_dex.Writer: Jeff Vintar (screenplay), Akiva Goldsman (screenplay), Jeff Vintar (screen story), Isaac Asimov (suggested by book)
movie_dex.Plot: In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot, which leads to a larger threat to humanity.

movie_dex.Title: Baby Driver
movie_dex.Plot: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail.

movie_dex.Title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
movie_dex.Writer: Stefan Zweig (inspired by the writings of), Wes Anderson (screenplay), Wes Anderson (story), Hugo Guinness (story)
movie_dex.Plot: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

movie_dex.Title: The Devil Wears Prada
movie_dex.Plot: A smart but sensible new graduate lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the demanding editor-in-chief of a high fashion magazine.

movie_dex.Title: Attila Marcel
movie_dex.Plot: Paul, thirty or so, lives in a Paris apartment with his aunts, two old aristocrats who have raised him since he was two and who dream of seeing him become a virtuoso pianist.

movie_dex.Title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
movie_dex.Writer: John Logan (screenplay), Hugh Wheeler (musical), Christopher Bond (musical adaptation)
movie_dex.Plot: The infamous story of Benjamin Barker, aka Sweeney Todd, who sets up a barber shop in London which is the basis for a sinister partnership with his fellow tenant, Mrs. Lovett.

movie_dex.Title: Spy
movie_dex.Plot: A desk-bound CIA analyst volunteers to go undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer, and prevent diabolical global disaster.

movie_dex.Title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence
movie_dex.Writer: Brian Aldiss (short story "Supertoys Last All Summer Long"), Ian Watson (screen story), Steven Spielberg (screenplay)
movie_dex.Plot: A highly advanced robotic boy longs to become "real" so that he can regain the love of his human mother.

movie_dex.Title: District 9
movie_dex.Plot: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

movie_dex.Title: Tomorrowland
movie_dex.Genre: Action, Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Mystery, Sci-Fi
movie_dex.Writer: Damon Lindelof (screenplay by), Brad Bird (screenplay by), Damon Lindelof (story by), Brad Bird (story by), Jeff Jensen (story by)
movie_dex.Plot: Bound by a shared destiny, a teen bursting with scientific curiosity and a former boy-genius inventor embark on a mission to unearth the secrets of a place somewhere in time and space that exists in their collective memory.

movie_dex.Title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
movie_dex.Plot: While still out to destroy the evil Umbrella Corporation, Alice joins a group of survivors living in a prison surrounded by the infected who also want to relocate to the mysterious but supposedly unharmed safe haven known only as Arcadia.

movie_dex.Title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
movie_dex.Plot: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

movie_dex.Title: Brain on Fire
movie_dex.Plot: A young, capable professional cannot explain her newly erratic behavior.

movie_dex.Title: Eat Pray Love
movie_dex.Writer: Ryan Murphy (screenplay), Jennifer Salt (screenplay), Elizabeth Gilbert (book)
movie_dex.Plot: A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself".

movie_dex.Title: Constantine
movie_dex.Writer: Jamie Delano (comic book "Hellblazer"), Garth Ennis (comic book "Hellblazer"), Kevin Brodbin (story), Kevin Brodbin (screenplay), Frank A. Cappello (screenplay)
movie_dex.Plot: Supernatural exorcist and demonologist John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more.

movie_dex.Title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
movie_dex.Writer: Stephen Chbosky (screenplay by), Stephen Chbosky (based on his book)
movie_dex.Plot: An introvert freshman is taken under the wings of two seniors who welcome him to the real world.

movie_dex.Title: Closer
movie_dex.Plot: The relationships of two couples become complicated and deceitful when the man from one couple meets the woman of the other.

movie_dex.Title: Salt
movie_dex.Plot: A CIA agent goes on the run after a defector accuses her of being a Russian spy.

movie_dex.Title: The Fifth Element
movie_dex.Writer: Luc Besson (screenplay by), Robert Mark Kamen (screenplay by), Luc Besson (story by)
movie_dex.Plot: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.

movie_dex.Title: Identity
movie_dex.Plot: Stranded at a desolate Nevada motel during a nasty rain storm, ten strangers become acquainted with each other when they realize that they're being killed off one by one.
